intro: Aylostera iscayachensis, commonly known as the Iscayachensis shrub, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or gray hairs. Aylostera iscayachensis is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat, including strong winds and intense sunlight.
